generator.oval:product_name: National Institute of Standards and Technology

metadata.title: Account Lockout Duration
metadata.description: This definition verifies that locked accounts remains locked for the defined number of minutes before they are automatically unlocked.

criterion.comment: Account Lockout Duration is set to keep accounts locked for at least the defined number of minutes
Account Lockout Duration is set to keep accounts locked until an administrator unlocks them

metadata.title: Account Lockout Threshold
metadata.description: Account lockout threshold is the profile defined number of invalid logon attempts

criterion.comment: Account lockout threshold is profile defined number of invalid logon attempts

metadata.title: Account Lockout Reset
metadata.description: Reset account lockout counters after the profile defined number of minutes

criterion.comment: Reset account lockout counters after profile defined number of minutes

metadata.description: todo

metadata.description: todo

criterion.comment: Kerberos: Maximum lifetime for service ticket

metadata.description: todo

criterion.comment: Kerberos: Maximum lifetime for user ticket

metadata.title: Kerberos: Maximum lifetime for user ticket renewal
metadata.description: todo

criterion.comment: Kerberos: Maximum lifetime for user ticket renewal

metadata.title: Kerberos: Maximum tolerance for computer clock synchronization
metadata.description: todo

criterion.comment: Kerberos: Maximum tolerance for computer clock synchronization

metadata.title: Password History Enforcement
metadata.description: Password history enforcement is enabled and the profile defined number of passwords are remembered

criterion.comment: Password history enforcement is enabled and profile defined number of passwords are remembered

metadata.title: Maximum Password Age
metadata.description: Maximum password age is the profile defined number of days

criterion.comment: Maximum password age is profile defined

metadata.title: Minimum Password Age
metadata.description: Minimum password age is the profile defined number of days

criterion.comment: Minimum password age is profile defined number of days

metadata.title: Minimum Password Length
metadata.description: Minimum password length is the profile defined number of characters

criterion.comment: Minimum password length is profile defined

metadata.title: Password Complexity Requirements
metadata.description: Passwords must meet complexity requirements

metadata.title: Passwords Stored Using Reversible Encryption
metadata.description: Passwords must be stored using reversible encryption for all users in the domain

criterion.comment: Passwords must be stored using reversible encryption for all users in the domain

metadata.title: Maximum Application Log Size
metadata.description: This definition tests the the maximum allowed size of the application log is at least as big as the supplied value.

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Application!MaxSize has type REG_DWORD and a value greater than or equal to the defined number of KB

metadata.title: Maximum Security Log Size
metadata.description: This definition tests the the maximum allowed size of the security log is at least as big as the supplied value.

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Security!MaxSize has type REG_DWORD and a value greater than or equal to the defined number of KB

metadata.title: Maximum System Log Size
metadata.description: This definition tests the the maximum allowed size of the system log is at least as big as the supplied value.

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\System!MaxSize has type REG_DWORD and a value greater than or equal to the defined number of KB

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to Application Log
metadata.description: This definition tests to see if local guests group is allowed to or prevented from accessing application log based on the supplied value.

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to Security Log
metadata.description: This definition tests to see if local guests group is allowed to or prevented from accessing security log based on the supplied value.

metadata.title: Anonymous Access to System Log
metadata.description: This definition tests to see if local guests group is allowed to or prevented from accessing system log based on the supplied value.

metadata.title: Application Log Retention Method
metadata.description: This definition tests the retention method for the application log. Possible methods are - overwrite as necessary, do not overwrite, or overwrite events older than X seconds.

metadata.title: Security Log Retention Method
metadata.description: Retention method for security log

metadata.title: System Log Retention Method
metadata.description: Retention method for system log

metadata.title: Administrators and System User Have Full Access to the SYSTEMROOT/system32/rcp.exe File
metadata.description: The Administrators group and the System user should have full access to the SYSTEMROOT/system32/rcp.exe file and all other users should have no file access privileges

criterion.comment: The Administrators group is granted full access to the file rcp.exe
The System user is granted full access to the file rcp.exe
There are no access privileges to file rcp.exe by users not part of the Administrators group or the System user

metadata.title: DCOM: Machine Access Restrictions in Security Descriptor Definition Language (SDDL) syntax
metadata.description: This check verifies that Windows Server 2003/XP, is configured to restrict DCOM access permissions.

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\DCOM!MachineAccessRestriction does not exist

metadata.title: DCOM: Machine Launch Restrictions in Security Descriptor Definition Language (SDDL) syntax
metadata.description: This check verifies that Windows Server 2003/XP, is configured to restrict DCOM launch permissions.

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\DCOM!MachineLaunchRestriction does not exist

metadata.title: Allowing Undock without Logon Disabled
metadata.description: Allow undock without having to log on disabled

metadata.title: Devices: Allowed to format and eject removable media
metadata.description: Devices: Allowed to format and eject removable media

metadata.title: Users Prevented from Installing Printer Drivers
metadata.description: Prevent users from installing printer drivers

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Print\Providers\LanMan Print Services\Servers\AddPrinterDrivers has type REG_DWORD
Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Print\Providers\LanMan Print Services\Servers\AddPrinterDrivers= profile defined

metadata.title: CD-ROM Access Restricted to Locally Logged-on User Only
metadata.description: Restrict CD-ROM access to locally logged-on user only

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\AllocateCDRoms has type REG_SZ

metadata.title: Floppy Access Restricted to Locally Logged-on User Only
metadata.description: Restrict floppy access to locally logged-on users only

metadata.title: Unsigned Driver Installation Warning
metadata.description: Warn for unsigned driver installation

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Driver Signing\Policy has type REG_BINARY

metadata.title: Domain controller: Allow server operators to schedule tasks
metadata.description: This setting determines if Server Operators are allowed to submit jobs using the AT schedule utility.

metadata.title: Domain controller: LDAP server signing requirements
metadata.description: Requires signing be negotiated before Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) clients can bind with Active Directory LDAP server.

metadata.title: Domain controller: Refuse machine account password changes
metadata.description: Determines whether a domain controller will accept password requests for computer accounts.

metadata.title: Secure Channel Data Always Digitally Encrypted or Signed
metadata.description: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)

metadata.title: Secure Channel Data Digitally Encrypted or Signed When Possible
metadata.description: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible)

metadata.title: Secure Channel Data Digitally Signed When Possible
metadata.description: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible)

metadata.title: Machine Account Password Changes Disabled
metadata.description: Disable machine account password changes

metadata.title: Maximum Machine Account Password Age
metadata.description: Maximum machine account password age is profile defined number of days

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netlogon\Parameters\MaximumPasswordAge less than or equal to oval:gov.nist.fdcc.xp:var:30

metadata.title: Strong Session Key Required
metadata.description: Require strong (Windows 2000 or later) session key

metadata.title: Last User Name Not Disaplayed for Logon
metadata.description: Do not display last user name logged on

metadata.title: CTRL+ALT+DEL Not Required for Logon

metadata.title: Message Title for Users Attempting to Log On
metadata.description: Set message title for users attempting to log on

metadata.title: Number of Previous Logons to Cache
metadata.description: Number of previous logons to cache (in case domain controller is not available) is profile defined

metadata.title: Password Change Prompt before Expiration
metadata.description: Prompt user to change password before expiration

metadata.title: Domain Controller Authentication Required to Unlock Workstation
metadata.description: Require Domain Controller authentication to unlock workstation

metadata.title: Interactive logon: Require Smart card
metadata.description: Forces use of a SmartCard to log in at the workstation interactively.

metadata.description: MSS: (AutoAdminLogon) Enable Automatic Logon disabled

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\AutoAdminLogon has type REG_SZ

metadata.title: IP Source Routing Protection Level
metadata.description: MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting) IP source routing protection level

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\ System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\DisableIPSourceRouting has type REG_DWORD

metadata.title: Automatic Detection of Dead Network Gateways Disabled
metadata.description: MSS: (EnableDeadGWDetect) Allow automatic detection of dead network gateways

metadata.title: ICMP Redirects to Override OSPF Generated Routes Disabled
metadata.description: MSS: (EnableICMPRedirect) Allow ICMP redirects to override OSPF generated routes disabled

metadata.title: EnablePMTUDiscovery
metadata.description: When this parameter is set to 1, TCP attempts to discover the Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU), the size of the largest packet that can be kept intact over the path to a remote host. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the feature and causes an MTU of 576 bytes to be used for all connections that are not made to hosts on the local subnet.

metadata.title: Computer Hidden from the Browse List
metadata.description: MSS: (Hidden) Hide Computer From the Browse List

metadata.title: How Often Keep-Alive Packets Are Sent
metadata.description: MSS: (KeepAliveTime) How often keep-alive packets are sent in milliseconds

metadata.title: NoDefaultExempt for IPSEC Filtering Enabled
metadata.description: MSS: (NoDefaultExempt) Enable NoDefaultExempt for IPSec Filtering

metadata.title: Autorun Disabled for All Drives
metadata.description: MSS: (NoDriveTypeAutoRun) Disable Autorun for all drives

metadata.title: NetBIOS Name Release Requests Except from WINS Servers Ignored
metadata.description: MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow the computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers

metadata.title: 8.3 Style Filenames Not Generated
metadata.description: MSS: (NtfsDisable8dot3NameCreation) Enable the computer to stop generating 8.3 style filenames

metadata.title: IRDP Allowed to Detect and Configure DefaultGateway Addresses
metadata.description: MSS: (PerformRouterDiscovery) Allow IRDP to detect and configure DefaultGateway addresses

metadata.title: Safe DLL Search Mode Enabled
metadata.description: MSS: (SafeDllSearchMode) Enable Safe DLL search mode

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\SafeDllSearchMode has type REG_DWORD

metadata.title: Screen Saver Grace Period Expiration of 0
metadata.description: MSS (ScreenSaverGracePeriod) The time in seconds before the screen saver grace period expires

criterion.comment: Registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ScreenSaverGracePeriod is less than or equal to Variable

metadata.description: Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonyumously

criterion.comment: NullSessionPipes registry key has value COMNAP

metadata.title: Remotely Accessible Registry Paths
metadata.description: Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths

criterion.comment: Machine registry key has value System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Server Applications
Machine registry key has value Software\Microsoft\OLAP Server
Machine registry key has value Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion
Machine registry key has value System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server

metadata.title: Prohibit non-administrators from applying vendor signed updates

metadata.title: Do Not Show First Use Dialog Boxes
metadata.description: Do Not Show First Use Dialog Boxes This policy prevents the Privacy Options and Installation Options dialog boxes from being displayed the first time a user starts Windows Media Player. This policy prevents the dialog boxes which allow users to select privacy, file types, and other desktop options from being displayed when the Player is first started. Some of the options can be configured by using other Windows Media Player group policies. When this policy is not configured or disabled, the dialog boxes are displayed when the user starts the Player for the first time.

metadata.title: Prevent Automatic Updates
metadata.description: Prevents users from being prompted to update Windows Media Player. This policy prevents the Player from being updated and prevents users with administrator rights from being prompted to update the Player if an updated version is available. The Check for Player Updates command on the Help menu in the Player is not available. In addition, none of the time intervals in the Check for updates section on the Player tab are selected or available. When this policy is not configured or disabled, Check for Player Updates is available only to users with administrator rights and they may be prompted to update the Player if an updated version is available. By default, users with administrator rights can select how frequently updates are checked for. Users without administrator rights do not see Check for Player Updates and are never prompted to update the Player even without this policy.

metadata.title: Prevent Desktop Shortcut Creation
metadata.description: This policy prevents a shortcut icon for the Player from being added to the user's desktop. When this policy is not configured or disabled, users can choose whether to add the Player shortcut icon to their desktops.
